;;1977 年星球大战电影《新希望》中角色 C-3PO 所佩戴的金色头盔。
;

;英国演员安东尼·丹尼尔斯计划出售他在 1977 年星球大战电影《新希望》中扮演 C-3PO 时所穿服装中的金色头盔。该头盔预计售价超过 122 万美元。

;

;;据英国广播公司报道，; 77 岁的丹尼尔斯正在通过英国拍卖商 Propstore 出售他个人收藏的该系列服装、道具和剧本。他告诉媒体，他希望这近 200 件藏品能够“找到一个好归宿”。

;

;“在制作完成后，我确实从埃尔斯特里工作室后面的篝火中救出了千年隼的那些碎片。丹尼尔斯告诉英国广播公司：“《绝地归来》。” 头部的出售以及丹尼尔斯的许多星球大战纪念品将吸引数百万粉丝，以及潜在的伊沃克人星球大战系列的粉丝相信 C-3PO 是神。

;

;“感觉是时候了，”丹尼尔斯在解释他出售该系列的原因时说道。 “我意识到我拥有这些物品，它们并非不受欢迎，但也没有被人关注——我们不会让它们挤满客厅。”

;

;其他待拍卖的星球大战物品包括汉·索罗的物品太空飞船，以及《帝国反击战》的带注释配音脚本。

;

;;最昂贵的星球大战道具曾经售出的是 43 英寸的 R2-D2 机器人，在 2017 年以 276 万美元的价格拍卖，其次是 X-Wing 宇宙飞船模型，拍出了 230 万美元的价格。 1980 年的《帝国反击战》中达斯·维德的玻璃纤维和泡沫头盔于 2019 年出售，售价为 90 万美元。

;

;丹尼尔斯告诉 BBC，他本可以在 2019 年的《天行者崛起》完成后添加到他的收藏中，但他觉得自己已经拥有了“足够”的纪念品。

;

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 22:22:02 +0800 Colombia passes ambitious ‘junk food law’ to tackle lifestyle diseaseshttps://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/nov/10/colombia-junk-food-tax-improve-health-acc
;;2023-11-10T14:08:35Z;
;
;;哥伦比亚卡塔赫纳一家商店中展示的彩色包装休闲食品。
;

;新哥伦比亚的法律使其成为世界上第一个明确对超加工食品征税的国家之一，受到了活动家和健康专家的赞扬，他们表示这可以为其他国家树立榜样。

;

;经过多年的活动《垃圾食品法》本月生效，征税将逐步出台。将立即开始对受影响食品征收 10% 的额外税，明年升至 15%，并于 2025 年达到 20%。

;

;“世界各国一直在实施健康税，例如通过对烟草或烟草征税来征收健康税。”伦敦帝国理工学院商学院国际卫生政策和经济学教授弗朗哥·萨西（Franco Sassi）表示： “哥伦比亚的模式比我们以前看到的更加广泛，可以作为其他国家的榜样。”

; ;

;征税对象是工业生产的即食食品，以及高盐和饱和脂肪的超加工产品，例如巧克力或薯片。萨西表示，已经与食品行业做出了一些妥协，例如将某些加工食品（例如香肠）排除在税收之外。

;

;哥伦比亚饮食中的钠含量很高，这与钠含量的增加有关心血管疾病，如中风和心力衰竭，每年造成近四分之一的死亡。哥伦比亚人平均消费;每天 12 克盐;——拉丁美洲最高，也是世界上最高的。该国近三分之一的成年人患有高血压。

;

;与饮食和肥胖相关的其他非传染性疾病（例如糖尿病）也存在问题，超过三分之一的死亡归因于糖尿病。 70 岁以下人群中。

;

;非传染性疾病估计占哥伦比亚所有死亡人数的 76%。

;

;“我们希望避免重蹈发达国家等富裕工业化国家的覆辙。 “在美国，与饮食相关的疾病是一个大问题，”拉丁美洲倡导组织美洲健康联盟执行董事比阿特丽斯·香槟 (Beatriz Champagne) 说。 “在政策方面，拉丁美洲处于领先地位。”

;

;萨西说：“哥伦比亚的非凡之处在于税收政策与包装正面标签保持一致。”该国;效仿其邻国;厄瓜多尔和秘鲁，正在对含有以下成分的食品引入强制性健康警告：不健康成分含量高，例如糖或饱和脂肪。

;

;“该税适用于带有健康警告标签的相同产品，”Sassi 说。 “这为消费者提供了避免使用这些产品的信息和经济激励。”

;

;活动人士表示，他们遇到了;在该法律颁布之前的几年里，来自食品和饮料行业的强烈反对;。

;
;

; ;相关：;;全球调查发现 40% 的病例未确诊糖尿病;

;
;

;来自 ; 的 Esperanza Cerón Villaquirán Educar Consumidores; 是一个自 2015 年以来一直致力于健康税和产品标签宣传的组织，该组织表示：“我们的团队遭受了我们国家禁止的各种攻击和审查。

;

;“我们的努力投资不仅是机构性的，也是个人性的。我们从未放松警惕，我们坚持不懈。”

;

;Cerón Villaquirán 将导致该法律颁布的多年努力描述为类似于“艰难的诞生”。

;

;批评者的新税收表示这将加剧哥伦比亚与通货膨胀的斗争。

;

;“生活成本危机和食品价格对通货膨胀的主要贡献意味着在大多数国家很难谈论引入新税收， ”萨西说道。 “但可以在现有税收框架内制定激励措施，例如通过降低健康食品的增值税来补贴对不健康食品增加的税收。”

;

;“最终，工业化食品生产的目标是不是营养而是赚钱，”香槟说。 “这意味着生产者并不关心消费者食用的食物是否会使他们生病或死亡。”

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 22:22:02 +0800 Trump suggests he would use FBI to go after political rivals if elected in 2024https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2023/nov/10/trump-fbi-rivals-2024-election

;
;;唐纳德·特朗普周一在纽约州最高法院的民事欺诈审判中等待出庭作证纽约。
;

;唐纳德·特朗普表示，如果他明年重返白宫，他将利用联邦调查局和司法部追捕政治对手，此举将进一步引发人们对第二任期的担忧。对于特朗普来说可能意味着。

;

;特朗普;在接受采访时发表了上述言论; 与西班牙语电视网 Univision 合作。主持人恩里克·阿塞维多（Enrique Acevedo）问他大量的法律问题，他说：“你说他们武器化了司法部门，他们武器化了联邦调查局。如果你连任，你会做同样的事情吗？”

;

;“他们已经这样做了，但如果他们想坚持到底，是的，这肯定会发生相反的情况，”特朗普回答道。 “他们已经释放了开箱即用的精灵。”

;

;“当你是总统并且你做得很好并且很受欢迎时，你就不会追随他们，这样你就可以赢得选举。他们提出起诉是为了赢得选举。他们称之为武器化，”特朗普补充道。 “但是，是的，他们做了一些事情，允许下一个政党，我的意思是，如果有人，如果我碰巧成为总统，我看到有人做得很好，并且把我打得很厉害，我说下去并起诉他们，大多数情况下他们会出局的业务。他们会出去的。他们会退出选举。”

;

;起诉政治对手是独裁政权的标志，而特朗普的言论是迄今为止最坦诚的公开揭露，他将把反民主权力带入第二个阶段。总统任期。

;

;特朗普是共和党 2024 年提名竞选中压倒性的领跑者，目前还没有出现能够真正挑战他的竞争对手。在最近针对乔·拜登的全国民意调查中，特朗普也经常被证明领先——这让许多民主党人感到不安。

;

;《华盛顿邮报》;本月早些时候报道;，特朗普及其盟友已经在讨论如何利用司法部门起诉和报复那些公开反对特朗普的人，包括前司法部长比尔·巴尔和他的前幕僚长约翰·凯利。

;

;他也是;据报道，如果他获胜，他会考虑;在上任第一天援引《叛乱法》，这将使他能够部署军队镇压国内抗议者。

;

;特朗普面临;四起单独的刑事案件;，其中包括两起不同的联邦案件涉及他处理机密文件以及他推翻选举的努力。这两起案件都是由司法部特别检察官杰克·史密斯(Jack Smith);由司法部长梅里克·加兰(Merrick Garland)任命< /a>;，以使案件免受政治压力。

;

;如果特朗普赢得选举，如果调查仍在进行中，他几乎肯定会解雇史密斯，如果他被定罪，他几乎肯定会赦免自己。

; >; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 22:22:02 +0800 EU strikes landmark deal on law to restore and protect naturehttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/10/eu-strikes-landmark-deal-nature-restoration-law

;;2023-11-10T13:18:10Z;
;
;;意大利皮埃蒙特朗格地区的拉莫拉村及其葡萄园。
;

;欧盟立法者和成员国在淡化了批评者认为会给农民带来麻烦的规则后，就一项具有里程碑意义的自然保护法律达成协议。

;

;自然恢复法是欧洲绿色协议中备受争议的支柱，将迫使欧盟国家在本世纪末恢复至少20%的陆地和海洋。它包含了到那时恢复至少 30% 退化栖息地的约束性目标，到 2040 年增加到 60%，到 2050 年增加到 90%。

;

;“我们面临着日益严峻的现实：欧盟的自然和生物多样性西班牙环境部长特蕾莎·里贝拉 (Teresa Ribera) 表示：“它们正处于危险之中，需要受到保护。”

;

;在整个非洲大陆对绿色政策的强烈反对中，政客们对法律中的条款展开了激烈的争论。欧洲人民党 (EPP) 是欧盟委员会主席、绿色协议倡导者乌尔苏拉·冯德莱恩 (Ursula von der Leyen) 所属的中右翼团体，该党的反对派几乎在 7 月份的投票中完全否决了该法案。

;

;环保人士对周四晚间代表成员国的欧洲理事会与议会达成的协议表示不温不火的支持。

;

;“我们很欣慰地看到谈判代表没有完全让欧洲失败。欧洲鸟类保护协会自然恢复政策官员 Sofie Ruysschaert 说道。

;

;议会中最大的政治团体 EPP 表示，很高兴其他团体采取了其立场。它表示，文本的“显着改进”包括取消了确保 10% 农田拥有树篱和花条等景观元素的要求，并添加了一行内容，说明各国没有义务使用欧盟农业基金中的资金来保护自然。
;
;该组织还为农民争取了几项豁免，包括在粮食生产受到威胁时冻结环境目标的“紧急刹车”。

;

;“我们欢迎以下事实：最终文本为该组织进行谈判的德国欧洲议会议员克里斯汀·施奈德 (Christine Schneider) 表示：“这项法律与委员会最初的提案没有什么关系。” “该委员会的提议是受意识形态驱动的，实际上不可行，对农民、森林所有者、渔民以及地方和地区当局来说是一场灾难，特别是在人口稠密的地区。”生物多样性和生态系统服务政府间科学政策平台（IPBES）在其 2019 年科学研究回顾中发现，历史对人类和地球造成了毁灭性后果。在欧洲，超过 80% 的栖息地状况不佳，自然恢复法的提出是为了扭转这一趋势并阻止地球变暖。

;

;欧盟也受到全球承诺的约束。去年在蒙特利尔举行的生物多样性峰会上，世界领导人承诺到 2030 年保护地球 30% 的面积。如今，世界上只有 17% 的陆地和 10% 的海洋受到保护。

;

;亥姆霍兹环境研究中心昆虫学家、IPBES 前联合主席约瑟夫·塞特勒 (Josef Settele) 表示，该法律的谈判正在进行中是向前迈出的重要一步，“但20%面积的生态系统恢复仍低于国际社会商定的30%的目标。”

;

;他补充说，他看到了“达摩克利斯之剑”该条款规定，如果粮食安全受到威胁，农民可以紧急刹车。 “这表明，在农业系统转型的背景下，自然恢复可以提高粮食产量，这仍然不是常识。”

;

;保护自然是让人们免受恶劣天气和气候影响的一种廉价方式。减少地球供暖污染的关键工具。欧盟委员会估计，用于恢复土地的每一欧元投资将带来 8 欧元（7 英镑）至 38 欧元的回报。

;

;Katrin Böhning-Gaese，法兰克福森肯伯格生物多样性和气候研究中心主任，赞扬了被称为三部曲的谈判结果，因为其中包括了议会之前投票决定取消的几个部门。

;

;“从科学和经济的角度来看，很明显，我们需要如果我们想在今天和未来在地球上过上美好的生活，就更好地保护和恢复自然，”她说。 “理性的声音现在在三部曲中占了上风；我们可以对自然和人类更加乐观地展望未来。”

;

;自然恢复法受到了一场激烈的运动的影响，科学家批评该法传播错误信息。今年早些时候，超过 6,000 名科学家签署了一封公开信，批评该法律的反对者与研究确立的事实相矛盾。

;

;该法律现在必须在成员国加入之前由议会和理事会正式通过。制定保护其栖息地的国家行动计划。谈判代表添加了一条内容，要求委员会提供欧盟可以提供的资金概览，并在法律生效一年后分析任何资金缺口。

;

;“自然不会解读政治。亥姆霍兹环境研究中心的生物学家、这封信的主要作者盖伊·佩尔 (Guy Pe'er) 说： “如果我们在自然上失败，我们的未来就失败了。”

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 21:52:01 +0800 South Africa to introduce shared parental leave after landmark judgmenthttps://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/nov/10/south-africa-to-introduce-shared-parental-leave-after-landmark-judgment
;;2023-11-10T13:34:36Z;
;
;;南非开普敦郊区尼扬加镇一名男子抱着自己的孩子
;< p>;南非将成为非洲第一个引入;共享育儿假的国家;高等法院裁定父母双方在婴儿出生或收养孩子后都必须有权休假。

;

;;具有里程碑意义的判断;允许父母选择如何将四个月的育儿假分配给他们。

;

;以前，母亲有权享受四个月的育儿假，而父亲或伴侣最多可以享受 10 天的假期。

;

;虽然有所增长过去 20 年来保证父亲带薪休假的非洲国家数量，;许多国家的时间仍低于三周;。有些国家只允许两到三天休息。

;

;活动人士称此举是向前迈出的一大步。性别平等组织 Equimundo 的 MenCare 官员 Wessel van den Berg 表示：“这以一种奇妙的方式提高了父母休假的标准。我很高兴我们的法律变得更加符合我们的宪法。”

;

;他补充说，虽然该判决是“一个重要的里程碑”，但它也强调了进一步改革的必要性，以使政策与社会规范保持一致以及国内的现实生活。政客们有两年的时间来完善和制定法律。

;

;母亲社会运动 Embrace 的倡导和传播策略师恩库鲁莱科·姆布利 (Nkululeko Mbuli) 表示，虽然这一判决“是朝着正确方向迈出的一步......

;

;她说，上个月发布的判决将责任归咎于谁拿什么假，而不是“建立一个关爱体系”。她还表示，失业者和从事无保障工作的人被排除在外。

;

;她补充道：“母亲们希望感到兴奋，但她们担心实际影响。”她说，母亲们可能必须比她们想要的更早重返工作岗位，这可能会给她们的心理健康带来负担。

;

;Thandile Ndoda，30 岁，住在开普敦，正在与丈夫生孩子，宽达，34 岁，今年晚些时候。宽达表示，他对这一“进步”举动感到高兴，并将请更多的假来支持桑迪尔。但两人都同意母亲不应该放弃产假。

;

;“我认为应该允许父亲更多地呆在家里，但我不同意牺牲母亲的产假，”坦迪尔说。

;

;Kwanda 补充道：“我认为新一代男性正在采取更加自由的立场。他们希望成为孩子生活的核心部分。”

;

;他们与 Van den Berg 和 Mbuli 一起，希望看到不可转让的“使用它或失去它”的额外部分留给双方父母，这不会缩短共享休假时间，如;西班牙;和瑞典。

;

;“旅程还远未结束，”范登伯格说，“但这一判决代表着南非朝着更加公平和平衡的护理环境迈出了充满希望的一步。”

;;弗兰克·博尔曼于 1965 年 10 月 25 日在重量和平衡测试中检查 Gemini-7 航天器。
;

; 指挥阿波罗 8 号 1968 年圣诞节历史性飞行的宇航员弗兰克·博尔曼 (Frank Borman) 去世，享年 95 岁。

;

;博尔曼于周二在比林斯去世。据美国宇航局称，蒙大拿州。离开宇航员队伍后，他还在 20 世纪 70 年代和 80 年代初领导了陷入困境的东方航空公司。

;

;但他最出名的是他在美国宇航局的职责。他和他的机组人员詹姆斯·洛弗尔和威廉·安德斯是;第一个飞往月球的阿波罗任务月球; – 并将地球视为太空中一个遥远的球体。

;

;“今天我们记住了美国宇航局最好的之一。宇航员弗兰克·博尔曼是一位真正的美国英雄，”美国宇航局局长比尔·尼尔森在周四的一份声明中表示。 “他对航空和探索的毕生热爱超越了他对妻子苏珊的爱。”

;

;1968 年 12 月 21 日阿波罗 8 号从佛罗里达州卡纳维拉尔角发射升空后，三名宇航员度过了三天的时光前往月球，飞船在圣诞节前夕滑入月球轨道。他们于 12 月 24 日至 25 日绕行 10 圈，然后于 12 月 27 日返回家园。

;

;平安夜，宇航员通过轨道飞行器的现场电视直播朗读了《圣经》创世记。 “起初，上帝创造了天地。地球是无形的、空虚的；黑暗笼罩在深渊的表面。”

; ;

;博尔曼在广播结束时说道：“阿波罗8号的全体人员，我们以晚安、祝你好运、圣诞快乐结束，上帝保佑你们所有人——美好地球上的所有人。”

;

;洛弗尔和博尔曼此前曾在为期两周的双子座 7 号任务中一起飞行，该任务于 1965 年 12 月 4 日发射，当时飞行高度仅为 120 米。 1998 年，博尔曼对美联社表示，“双子星 6 号是一次艰难的尝试。它比大众 Bug 的前座还小。”它让阿波罗看起来像一辆超级豪华的旅游巴士。”

;

;博尔曼在他的《倒计时：自传》一书中说，阿波罗 8 号最初应该绕地球运行。 1968 年 10 月，阿波罗 7 号任务的成功展示了系统在长时间飞行中的可靠性，这使得美国宇航局决定是时候尝试飞向月球了。

;

;但博尔曼表示，美国宇航局改变计划还有另一个原因。计划：该机构想要击败俄罗斯。博尔曼说，他认为绕一圈就足够了。

;

;“在整个飞行过程中，我主要关心的是先于俄罗斯人到达那里并回家。在我看来，这是一项重大成就。”博尔曼 2017 年在芝加哥露面时说道。

;

;安德斯在机组人员的第四个轨道上拍摄了;地出照片;，显示蓝色和白色的地球在灰色的月球景观上方升起。

;

;博尔曼描述了从远处看地球的样子：“我们是第一批看到世界的宏伟整体的人类，这对我们每个人来说都是一次强烈的情感体验。我们彼此什么也没说，但我确信我们的想法是相同的——我们的家人在那个旋转的地球上。也许我们还有另一个共同的想法：“这一定是上帝所看到的。”

;

;继美国宇航局之后，博尔曼的航空事业于 1970 年进入商业领域，当时他加入了东方航空公司（当时是美国第四家航空公司）最大的航空公司。他最终成为东方航空的总裁兼首席执行官，并于 1976 年成为董事会主席。

;

;博尔曼在东方航空任职期间，燃油价格急剧上涨，政府放松了对航空业的管制。该公司变得越来越无利可图，负债累累，并因劳资紧张而陷入困境。他于 1986 年辞职，搬到了新墨西哥州的拉斯克鲁塞斯。

;

;博尔曼在自传中写道，他对飞行的迷恋始于十几岁，当时他和父亲组装模型飞机。 15 岁时，博尔曼用自己当包童和放学后当加油站服务员攒下的钱，学习了飞行课程。经过八小时的双重指导后，他进行了第一次单独飞行。他继续飞翔到 90 多岁。

;

;博尔曼出生于印第安纳州加里，但在亚利桑那州图森长大。他就读于西点军校美国军事学院，并于 1950 年获得理学学士学位。同年，博尔曼与高中时的恋人苏珊·巴格比 (Susan Bugbee) 结婚。她于 2021 年去世。

;

;博尔曼毕业后在西点军校担任美国空军战斗机飞行员、作战飞行员和教官。 1956 年，他举家搬到加利福尼亚州帕萨迪纳，并在那里获得了加州理工学院航空工程理学硕士学位。 1962 年，他是美国宇航局选拔的九名宇航员计划试飞员之一。

;

;他获得了吉米·卡特总统颁发的国会太空荣誉勋章。

;

;1998 年，博尔曼开始和他的儿子弗雷德在蒙大拿州比格霍恩的一个养牛场。除了弗雷德之外，他还有另一个儿子埃德温及其家人。

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 20:52:02 +0800 Lyrics to be introduced as evidence in trial of rapper Young Thughttps://www.theguardian.com/music/2023/nov/10/lyrics-introduced-evidence-in-trial-of-rapper-young-thug
;;2023-11-10T11:22:43Z;
;
;;Young Thug at a hearing in December 2022.
;

;A judge has said lyrics will be admissible as evidence in the trial of star US rapper Young Thug, a controversial practice that has been decried by free speech groups and other stars such as Jay-Z and Coldplay.

;

;Known for his distinctive vocal timbre, Young Thug, real name Jeffery Williams, is one of the most successful and critically acclaimed rappers in the US, whose albums So Much Fun and Punk both topped the charts there. He will shortly go on trial in his home city of Atlanta for racketeering, accused of running what prosecutors call “a criminal street gang” called YSL (Young Slime Life, also Young Stoner Life), members of which have been charged with murder, carjackings and other alleged crimes. Williams's legal team maintain YSL is a record label and music collective, with lawyer Brian Steel saying the rapper has “committed no violation of law whatsoever”.

;

;Twenty-eight people were initially charged, including another chart-topping rapper, Gunna (real name Sergio Kitchens), who took a plea deal that allowed him to maintain his innocence. Other defendants took plea deals, were not arrested, or saw their cases separated from the racketeering case, leaving Williams and five others still to face trial.

;

;The judge for the case, Ural Glanville, has now permitted prosecutors to introduce some Young Thug song lyrics as evidence, saying: “I'm going to conditionally admit particularised lyrics.”

;

;Addressing Williams's legal team during the hearing, Glanville argued prosecutors were “not prosecuting your clients because of the songs they wrote. They're using the songs to prove other things your clients may have been involved in … I don't think it's an attack on free speech.”

;

;;As reported by Fox 5 Atlanta;, prosecutor Mike Carlson said: “The lyrics are being used to prove the nature of YSL as a racketeering enterprise, the expectations of YSL as a criminal street gang. We've got party admissions for even the offence of murder here; this is evidentiary use.”

;

;Prosecutor Simone Hylton quoted lyrics in court: “'I just beat a murder rap, I paid my lawyer 30 for that.' There's a few other lyrics in between that and then: 'Me and my slimes are above the law.'”

;

;Lawyers for the defence countered that lyrics were creative expression, and could not be used as evidence or admissions of criminality. “There's a giant elephant in the room, which is that we're ignoring art,” said Doug Weinstein, attorney for Deamonte Kendrick, the rapper known as Yak Gotti, who is on trial alongside Williams. “There is art here and the art has got to be separated from real life … What Mr Kendrick is singing about is what he grew up around. What else is he supposed to sing about? He's not going to sing [the Monkees'] Daydream Believer. He's not going to write about puppies and rainbows and unicorns.”

;

;There is growing opposition to the practice of introducing lyrics as criminal evidence, which have been used in the trials against US rappers such as Tekashi 6ix9ine and Tay-K in recent years. The practice is increasingly widespread in the UK, with research ;published by the Guardian; finding 240 such cases in the last three years.

;

;In January 2022, Jay-Z and Meek Mill were among those ;supporting; a proposed change in New York state law that would prevent the introduction of lyrics as evidence, with state senator Jamaal Bailey arguing: “The right to free speech is enshrined in our federal and state constitutions. The admission of art as criminal evidence only serves to erode this fundamental right, and the use of rap and hip-hop lyrics in particular is emblematic of the systemic racism that permeates our criminal justice system.”

;

;Similar legislation has been proposed in Georgia, Atlanta's state, with US congressman Hank Johnson saying: “You should not be able to just simply put in some lyrics and say this is the state of mind of the person who is accused.”

;

;In September 2022, California outlawed the use of lyrics as evidence in state trials. Harvey Mason Jr, chief executive of the Recording Academy, which runs the Grammy awards, called it “an important victory … Silencing any genre or form of artistic expression is a violation against all music people.”

;

;In an address to fans from jail after he was denied bail multiple times, Williams encouraged fans to sign a petition titled Protect Black Art, saying: “I always use my music as a form of artistic expression, and I see now that Black artists and rappers don't have that freedom”. Kitchens stated on release from jail: “My art is not allowed to stand alone as entertainment, I'm not allowed that freedom as a Black man in America.”

;
;

;;Related: ;;Behind bars: how rap lyrics are being used to convict Black British men;

;
;

;In November 2022 the three major labels, streaming and social media companies, and a large number of artists including Megan Thee Stallion, Coldplay, Future and Post Malone, all backed the Protect Black Art movement with ;an open letter;. It argued the use of lyrics in trials is “un-American and simply wrong”, adding: “Rappers are storytellers, creating entire worlds populated with complex characters who can play both hero and villain. But more than any other art form, rap lyrics are essentially being used as confessions in an attempt to criminalise Black creativity and artistry.”

;

;After a jury selection process that has taken over 10 months, Williams's trial will begin on 27 November and is expected to last six to nine months according to Glanville.

;

;The rapper has released an album while in jail, Business Is Business, which reached No 2 in the US charts after its release in June.

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 19:52:01 +0800 On mute: Tijuana passes law banning ballads praising Mexican drug tradehttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/10/tijuana-mexico-drug-ballads-narcocorridos-ban
;;2023-11-10T11:00:04Z;
;
;;Peso Pluma has produced some of the most notorious recent examples of narcocorridos.
;

;A typical song by Peso Pluma, one of Mexico's most popular singers, might start with a guitar and a trumpet, sounding like something for the older crowd – but then come the lyrics telling of drug shipments, stacks of cash and diamond-encrusted pistols.

;

;Peso Pluma has produced some of the most ;notorious recent examples; of narcocorridos – ballads celebrating the exploits of the Mexican underworld that are hugely popular not just at home but across Latin America and the US.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Mexico authorities find 123 people trapped in locked trailer;

;
;

;One of them – a paean to a foot soldier of the Sinaloa cartel – probably led to recent death threats he received in the border city of Tijuana, forcing him to ;cancel concerts;.

;

;This week, local politicians voted to ban narcocorridos from being performed or even played in the city, in the latest attempt by politicians to censor the genre – even though previous such efforts seem to have, if anything, only boosted its popularity.

;

;Corridos originate from northern Mexico, where they once recounted the lives and bloody deaths of notorious bandits and revolutionaries. In recent decades, however, they have focused on the country's drug bosses with lyrics describing ;drug deals and brutal killings;.

;

;Famous songs include tributes to organised crime bosses like ;Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán;. Sometimes the artists are paid by traffickers to write and perform songs about them, portraying them as heroic outlaws.

;

;Mexican politicians have long attempted to silence the corridos which critics say the lyrics glorify violence and the drug trade. But in some cases the songs ;critique the realities of life; for those affected by the militarised “war on drugs”, which began in 2006 and has caused violence to soar in Mexico.

;

;On Wednesday, the Tijuana government passed a ban on narcocorridos, saying it wanted to reduce violence by protecting children and adolescents from this kind of music.

;

;“Because no matter how many weapons this municipality seizes or arrests we make, the most important thing is to take care of mental health, which begins with the eyes and ears,” said Montserrat Caballero Ramírez, the mayor.

;

;Fines for breaching the ban could approach £58,000 (about $70,000) and will go towards prevention and addiction treatment programs.

;

;The mayor added that the ban only applies to narcocorridos and artists are welcome in Tijuana.

;

;Tijuana, which sits across the frontier from San Diego, is regularly among the most violent cities in Mexico and the world. In 2022, there were 105.1 murders for every 100,000 inhabitants.

;

;Various other cities and states have implemented bans in the past. Specific artists have been singled out, too, from Tigres del Norte to Los Tucanes de Tijuana and El Komander.

;

;But such measures have done nothing to dent the popularity of the genre, which stands as testament to the drug trade's influence on popular culture.

;

;By contrast, ;one study; found that attempts at censorship had only been a commercial boost for the artists.

;

;“The fines and cancelled concerts only added to the image of El Komander as a rebel, and turned him into a hero in the eyes of his fans,” wrote the authors.

;

;More fundamentally, critics of censorship say that it is simply targeting artists instead of the root causes of violence – and that it inverts the underlying causality: blaming narcocorridos for drug violence, rather than the other way around.

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 19:22:01 +0800 Ransomware attack on China’s biggest bank disrupts US Treasury markethttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/10/ransomware-attack-on-china-biggest-bank-disrupts-us-treasury-market
;;2023-11-10T10:41:59Z;
;
;;Bank tellers in a branch office of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in Hong Kong in 2013
;

;The Industrial and Commercial Bank of China's US arm was hit by a ransomware attack that disrupted trades in the US Treasury market on Thursday, the latest in a string of victims ransom-demanding hackers have claimed this year.

;

;ICBC Financial Services, the US unit of China's largest commercial lender by assets, said it was investigating the attack that disrupted some of its systems, and making progress toward recovering from it.

;

;China's foreign ministry said on Friday the lender was striving to minimise risk impact and losses after the attack.

;

;“ICBC has been closely monitoring the matter and has done its best in emergency response and supervisory communication,” the ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said.

;

;Wang added that businesses remained normal at ICBC head office and other branches and subsidiaries across the globe.

;

;Hackers lock up a victim organisation's systems in such attacks and demand ransom for unlocking it, often also stealing sensitive data for extortion.

;

;Several ransomware experts and analysts said an aggressive cybercrime gang named Lockbit was believed to be behind the hack, although the gang's dark website where it typically posts names of its victims did not mention ICBC as a victim as of Thursday evening. Lockbit did not respond to a request for comment sent via a contact address posted on its site.

;

;“We don't often see a bank this large get hit with this disruptive of a ransomware attack,” said Allan Liska, a ransomware expert at the cybersecurity company Recorded Future.

;

;Liska, who also believes Lockbit was behind the hack, said ransomware gangs may not name and shame their victims when they are negotiating with them.

;

;“This attack continues a trend of increasing brazenness by ransomware groups,” he said. “With no fear of repercussions, ransomware groups feel no target is off limits.”

;

;US authorities have struggled to curb a rash of cybercrime, chiefly ransomware attacks, which hit hundreds of companies in almost every industry each year. Only last week US officials said they were working on curtailing the funding routes of ransomware gangs by improving information-sharing on such criminals across a 40-country alliance.

;

;The ICBC did not comment on whether Lockbit was behind the hack. It is common for targets to refrain from publicly disclosing the names of cybercrime gangs.

;

;Since Lockbit was discovered in 2020, the group has hit 1,700 US organisations, according to the US Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency. Last month it threatened Boeing with a leak of sensitive data.

;

;A Cisa spokesperson referred questions about the ICBC hack to the US Treasury department.

;

;While market sources said the impact of the hack appeared to be limited, it signalled how vulnerable systems at large organisations such as the bank continue to be. Thursday's incident is likely to raise questions over market participants' cybersecurity controls and draw regulatory scrutiny.
;
; ICBC said it had successfully cleared Treasury trades executed on Wednesday and repurchase agreements (repo) financing trades done on Thursday.

;

;“In general, the event had a limited impact on the market,” said Scott Skyrm, the executive vice-president for fixed income and repo at the broker-dealer Curvature Securities.

;

;Some market participants said trades going through ICBC were not settled because of the attack and affected market liquidity. It was not clear whether this contributed to the weak outcome of a 30-year bond auction on Thursday.

; Fri, 10 Nov 2023 18:52:01 +0800 Spanish police investigate possible Iran link to shooting of former politicianhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/10/spanish-police-investigate-possible-iran-link-to-shooting-of-former-politician-alejandro-vidal-quadras
;;2023-11-10T09:59:22Z;
;
;;Police officers cordon off the area where Alejandro Vidal-Quadras was shot in Madrid.
;

;The Spanish right-wing former politician Alejandro Vidal-Quadras is recovering in hospital after being shot in the face on a central Madrid street.

;

;Police said they were not ruling out any theories for the attack on Thursday afternoon, including a possible link to the former European lawmaker's ties with the Iranian opposition.

;

;A police source close to the investigation told the Associated Press there was no evidence backing the Iranian link, but confirmed that Vidal-Quadras himself had raised the suspicion from his hospital bed and that investigators were looking into it as one of several possible motives.

;

;In a sign that police were broadening the investigation to consider the Iranian angle, another official said a provincial brigade that handles terrorism and extremism cases joined the investigation, previously led by agents specialising in homicides, late on Thursday.

;

;Both officials spoke to AP under the condition of anonymity to protect the secrecy of the inquiries.

;

;Vidal-Quadras, 78, was ;attacked at around 1.30pm on Thursday; near his home in the capital and he was conscious when taken to hospital by emergency crews.

; ;

;There were no immediate arrests and police were checking surveillance footage and witness accounts to identify the shooter, who had been seen wearing a black helmet. The suspect had fired one gunshot before fleeing on a motorbike driven by an accomplice.

;

;A burnt motorbike found later in the day on the outskirts of Madrid was being investigated, one of the officials said.

;

;Four hours after the shooting, Madrid's Gregorio Marañón general university hospital said the bullet had fractured Vidal-Quadras's jawbone and that he would undergo surgery. It said the politician was in a stable condition and his life was not in danger.

;

;Vidal-Quadras was a member of Spain's conservative People's party, its regional leader in Catalonia, and a European parliament member before leaving after three decades when he fell out with the then prime minister, Mariano Rajoy.

;

;After he broke away, he helped found the far-right Vox party. He left Vox shortly after a failed attempt to win a European parliament seat in 2014.

;

;As part of his political career, Vidal-Quadras has been aligned for decades with the Iranian opposition in exile, an involvement that was noticed by Tehran.

;

;In January, the Iranian foreign ministry announced it had imposed sanctions on Vidal-Quadras along with others who had ties with the exiled ;People's Mujahedin of Iran, or MEK (Mujahedin-e Khalq);, accusing them of “supporting terrorism and terrorist groups”.

;

;The group began as a Marxist organisation opposing the rule of Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi. It claimed, and was suspected of, a series of attacks against US officials in Iran in the 1970s, something it now denies.

;

;In mid-September, addressing a conference organised by the group in Brussels, Vidal-Quadras criticized EU officials and leaders for not being strong enough in their opposition to Iran and in their support for the exiled opposition.

;

;In the past Iran's state-run media, citing reporting by the Spanish daily newspaper El País, has alleged Vidal-Quadras's Vox party received MEK money. It described the payments as “terrorist money”.

;

;The MEK leader, Maryam Rajavi, wrote on X, formerly Twitter: “The Iranian Resistance sees Iran's ruling religious fascism as the first suspect accused in this case, as Prof Vidal-Quadras has dedicated an important part of his life to fight against it.”

;

;The president of Vox, Santiago Abascal, said: “Thank God it seems that Alejandro Vidal-Quadras is out of danger.”

;

;The People's party president, Alberto Núñez Feijóo, denounced the shooting and the prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, said on X: “All my warmth at this moment [is] for him and his family.”

;

;Vidal-Quadras has not been active in politics for several years but has maintained a public role as a media commentator and columnist.
